We liked this bar so much that we went before anddddd after the baseball game. 21st Amendment doesn't have hard alcohol so they recommended that we check out the new place next door. This place was amazing. Definitely more upscale than your typical "sports" bar but still not pretentious. Apparently they make all of their mixers and juices in house so everything was super fresh and delicious. I had 2 drinks there, one, the bartender made up just after I told him my favorite alcohol and it was ridiculously good. The bartender, Adam, was so professional, knowledgable and kind. I really hope to be able to come back here again soon because everything was so good. 

My boyfriend is a bourbon drinker and there were so many interesting, hard to find choices on their shelves that he wanted to try. 

BUT, I mostly can't wait to come back and try the food! Their menu was upscale bar food with beautiful charcuterie choices and light sandwiches. 

Have I made it clear that I really liked this place?
author: Stephanie D.

description:
What What a cool place. 

I don't go often to other pubs. I usually have one place that I go often.   On my way home I stop here.  For a pint.  Place look great.  Staff  are grand.      Well done
author: Ford T.

description:
I went with a friend to Lord George on Sunday night and had such a fantastic time! Adam, our bartender, was first of all attentive, knowledgeable and prompt, but more than that, he really talked with us- he made the "sitting at the bar" experience the best it could be- you sit there to interact with the bartender right? We had such great conversation and he gave us suggestions on where to eat and drink in SF- two or three we acted on and THOSE were awesome, which just made Lord George and Adam that much more awesome (thank you Adam!). 
Also, this bar is open late night, with late night food options, which we found oddly scarce in San Francisco. So cheers to a late night option!
Our drinks were so good we ordered more; the entire experience was so nice we didn't want to leave. I'll absolutely be back the next time I am in San Francisco.
author: Kristine T.

description:
Great ambiance, amazing drinks and awesome workers.

If you want a place with great snacks and great drinks, this is it. 

This is not a place where you would have a first date. I ended up losing my voice at the end of the night because I was shouting so much with a girlfriend. I would definitely come back once I regain strength in my vocals.
author: Tiana C.

description: Adam is a fucking hilarious bartender. Great food and great drinks! Chill music. Just stop in its worth it! trust me!
author: Masara V.

description: We found them on Eater SF. Place was basically empty at 11am on Saturday. The food and service was top shelf considering we were 1 of 3 tables there. The New Yorker was to die for, whitefish salad, salmon, rye, onions, etc. Amazinggh
author: Paul P.

description: Right in the heart of SOMA tech district, this bar got the whole package - innovative cocktails and good food. The only drawback is that the happy hour ends really early at 6pm (or maybe it's a good reason to start off Friday early).
author: Joy L.

description: totally cool spot. good crowd and excellent bartending! obsessed with their negroni/manhattan/old fashioned combo. and the snake bite. my friends really enjoyed their cocktails as well! we ordered all three cheese and all three meats (boards are deelish), the fries (good) and duck confit tartine (good but messy and hard to eat). i'd come back for sure but i think they overcharged us by a drink or two... :(
author: Christina L.

description:
The drinks are fantastic, as is the food. I'm glad that SOMA finally has a quality pub with decent food. 

I would highly recommend Lord George, after only three visits it is quickly becoming a neighborhood favorite.
author: Matthew S.

description: I like their whiskey menu but nothing really stands out here for me. Staff is nice and good is okay as well. It's close to work but won't have a great reason to come all the way here. Will give it another try.
author: Tiff W.

description:
These guys don't not get it. Take care of the neighbors don't BS them when you screw up there meals. When the ball crowd and tech kids are not around you need our business. We do tip well!

This is the 411. I ordered Streak & Potatoes. Received no potato
author: Scott T.

description: Wonderful place. Staff is very nice and helpful and dress very dashing  Food is amazing and extra special for a meal that would just be another meal but they make it much more. Service is wonderful. Couldn't be happier and will definitely be back.
author: Ally B.

description: Well Yelp didn't like my honesty so I'll rewrite my review of this place. The rude service explains why this place was EMPTY on a game day. In addition, every drink we asked for they did not offer. Advice - if you go here - plan to over pay, be treated poorly and whatever you do don't chat with the back of the house staff, they're not allowed to socialize. This was literally the worst bar I've ever stepped into in SF. Don't waste a second here.
author: Rachel T.

description: The Jungle Spy was perfection and you could really taste the lemongrass, mint, citrus, and honey. The Clam Chowder was on point (creamy with lots of clams and topped with crispy bacon).
author: Jessica G.

description: We came here on probably the busiest day Lord George has had with the Super Bowl festivities and Metallica playing.  But they did a great job in serving us promptly and with great food.  We got the charcuterie board which was delicious and super filling.  We also got the duck tartine which had a really good flavor.  Others next to us got the oysters and they looked good too.  Great spot before a Giants game.
author: Blake B.

description:
Being a huge Belgian beer fan, this joint was right up my alley.  Craft Belgian style brews up the kazoo!  Funky pub type atmosphere with concrete floors, well used tables and straight back wooden chairs.  Definitely for the serious beer drinker. A bit noisy, but hey, it's Friday night!  I'm told this is a hangout for those who work in the area and I believe it...wall to wall nerds!

Service was prompt...waiter asked me what I wanted before my butt hit the chair!  Menu is typical burgers, pizza, and pub food.  Decided to eat elsewhere...too much great food in SF to settle for the mundane.
author: Howard B.

description:
They have done a nice job on the new place. I like the tables they have installed - the previous place didn't have one table that was stable. The bar staff was good and friendly and I think the prices are reasonable, too. Nice drink menu and wines/beer choices were more than acceptable. I see Christine S compared it to Southside Spirit House and I agree the look and feel is similar.

Sadly, I am not a fan of oysters so some of the thrill of the menu is lost on me. There really was only one thing on the menu well suited for me so if I have a criticism, its the menu choices - they are nice but limited. Its not unusual to sell a burger for $15 these days so just having a burger on the menu would open up some choices for a lot of people. I know its not trying to be Perry's or anything like it, but having some standards (i.e.; fancy burger) would be a nice expansion.

In the end, I had the "ham & cheese" sandwich which was very good, my partner had the whipped avocado sandwich - also very good. 

So if the menu were to expand a bit, I'd say this is the best place in the immediate area. But without it, I'll stop in for drinks, but unlikely they will get much of dinning dollars.
author: JX C.

description: I really loved having Adam as my bartender at Lord George! It should be Lord Adam, not Lord George. ;) He made me such yummy cocktails included Cobra Kai. I cannot remember the second cocktail he made with Bourbon for me. Will ask him about it when I go back there this weekend. Since it was the Game day, Happy hour specials were unavailable. I had no idea. Loved the decor and ambience. The place got filled up quickly. Great, friendly, professional and attentive service with delicious fresh oysters and cocktails. Look forward to going there soon.
author: Athena K.

description:
Total gem. I'll definitely be back x 10. 

Oysters were on point. The cocktail list and wine selection are both solid. Would definitely recommend for drinks or a light dinner!
author: Naureen H.

description: Came here after work on a Friday. I had a mojito, but they didn't have flavored mojitos. My co workers had oysters, they were bomb! The bartender was hospitable. Great ambiance for Friday after work drinks.
author: Marisa B.

description:
Decided to stop by here after work with some friends and I am now a fan.  All the tables were occupied but there were four seats at the bar open which was perfect for us. The noise level was not excessive and they had a baseball game on the big screen and it gave the place a laid back and sporty atmosphere.  Jason(?), our bartender, was courteous and kept an eye out for us in case we needed anything. 

We ordered drinks first, mine was a Manhattan and it came out perfect.  I got similar feedback from my friends regarding their drinks, a minted mule, a mojito and I forgot what the last one was but I think it was a gold rush. For food, we ordered a dozen mixed oysters and they came out on a raised, iced tray with 3 different sauces (one had soy sauce, one had vinegar, and the last was cocktail, none plain, all altered to compliment the oysters). The oysters were chilled, fresh and very tasty, although we ordered a dozen I could've eaten a 100. We also ordered some fries and they came out great. They came with a side of ketchup and mayo but the mayo seemed either made from scratch or something was added which did not turn out bad at all.  We enjoyed the drinks so much our "one drink, we're in a hurry" turned into an "alright, one more lets get a cobra Kai" which was a tasty and unique drink that came out tasting like oranges, lemons and chocolate. We will definitely be back! Our total tab for a dozen oysters, fries and six drinks came out to $110 including tip.
author: Jared S.

description:
Delicious, strong cocktails but this place is far too loud and far too small for my taste. There is nowhere enough seating on busy nights. Staff is friendly and helpful but I need to be able to hear what the other person is saying and would like to not share a table with strangers. There are many other options for good cocktails in the city.
Be warned, they don't take reservations.
author: Klara M.

description: Several weeks after writing a review, the owner reached out apologetically. Any business where management does its best to improve to make an enjoyable experience for customers gets another star. For this, we are happy to try Lord George again.
author: Kiai K.

description: Amazing experience. I love finding little bars with big character and didn't disappoint! The Ham and Cheese is to die for!
author: Tate H.

description: 20 of us stopped in for brunch on a Sunday around 11, and they were able to accommodate us pretty effortlessly (5 stars for service and ambiance). I had the baked eggs, which were pretty good (3 stars), but the huge smoked salmon tartine looked even better! Would love to try it next time. I've also been here once for cocktails on a weeknight and really liked the vibe and the fact that it was not too loud so you can easily have a conversation and actually hear each other.
author: Jia H.

description:
Love Lord George! We went very shortly after they opened and received excellent service.  Bartenders were very friendly and took the time to share with us their favorite cocktail.

The boards are delicious (got the veggie board), and the fries are amazing!
author: Melody J.

description: Came here the first time for happy hour, and found a seat at the bar before it got too crowded. They had decent happy hour drink and food specials (oysters, beer, wine, drinks, etc). Prices were reasonable considering the location. Service was extremely quick and friendly, and I never had an empty drink during the time I was there. Would definitely consider coming back again.
author: Nick M.

description: I give 5 stars based amazing drinks they have. The bartenders are very knowledgeable and friendly as well. I would say this place has the best cocktails I had in SF. Thumbs up!
author: mona k.

description: Love this place! Great little secret (or not so secret) spot! I just discovered it & already been there lots. Music is great, vegetable board, avocado toast , duck confit Tartine .. So so good! Friendly service! Will be back .
author: C A.

description: Go! GREAT Service and bomb food!!! Say Hi to Adam (AKA "Boots"), he's hilarious!!! Also, have the chowder
author: Melissa V.

description:
huge fan of this place! i went here with a couple of friends to grab drinks before a holiday party and it was so cozy. it wasn't super crowded at happy hour on a saturday, but there was a good mix of jolly people on their way back from and to santacon/holiday parties.

actually went again last night, and their cheese plate is BOMB: get the soft cow cheese and the sheep's milk with lavendar rind (not ewenique), and get the spicy salami. YUM!!!! affordable, tasty and cozy, this is my ideal neighborhood bar.
author: Reyana F.

description:
came here on a friday night after a wine tasting event and it was somewhat crowded. they were playing great old school hip hop and R&B. service tried to be good but it was just too many people with not enough servers.
oysters were ok, we also ordered the charcuterie board and fries for snacks.
cocktails were really really good.
overall a fun atmosphere.
author: Marie r.

description: A friend and I went on a Tuesday night so it wasn't super busy. Really good drinks, friendly bartenders, and non-hipster patrons. My favorite cocktails were the  Cobra Kai (Japanese whiskey, cocoa, ancho chile, vino aperitivo, citrus, honey, bitters) and the Snakebite Kit (mezcal, tequila, Galliano, vanilla, grapefruit, lemon, and bitters.
author: Rachel C.

description: Good food, friendly. Odd cow smell in the back booth.
author: Ona A.

description: Great drink selection and the first place where I've had a John Daly!  The owner's very very cool and he always welcomes my wife and baby with open arms.  Very friendly and great food as well!  An absolute must location to pregame before a Giants game!
author: Steve C.

description: Checked out this spot last minute and glad I went. Bartender Roberto was attentive and the drinks were bomb.com. I got the mint mules and so crisp and good. The clam chowder was soooooo good too. I was by myself so it was a bit busy for what I was looking for, but still had a great time.
author: Katherine R.

description:
Exceptional cocktails -- heard tables on either side remarking on how good their cocktails were as well. Highly recommend the French 75, husband had a gin martini.  Both were as good as it gets.  Nice a strong, and tasty.  
Really good food too. We ordered prawns, the duck confit open faced sandwich and a side of fries.  All delicious. The fries were noteworthy, probably double fried. Crispy with delish aoli that wasn't overpowering.  Nice!  
The decor is sophisticated but comfortable,the lighting perfect. Our bartender and waiter were the kind of people you'd like to invite to join you for a drink.  Smart and genuine,acted as if they owned the place, which maybe they do. Good job Lord George!
author: Stacey O.

description: Stopped by here at 5pm on a Friday for a drink with a friend, and really liked their drink options. The bartender recommended the Cobra Kai - Japanese wiskey, cocoa, ancho chile, vino aperitivo, citrus, honey, and bitter. And man was it good! Great concoction of flavors. My friend asked for something sweet and the classic daiquiri they brought her hit the spot. Nice spot.
author: Nikita K.

description: Good neighborhood bar.Tasty bar food,stiff drinks and friendly bartenders.FAVE DRINK:DREAMS OLD MEN DREAM
author: aj s.

description: Great place to grab a drink and great food too! try the oysters
author: Hara K.

description: Drinks are ok. Servers have great customer service. The happy hour oysters are the best in the city. Not the cheapest, but the freshest and cleanest. Their HH oysters were better shucked than the oysters from Epic on their regular menu. I'll definitely be back.
author: Yvonne N.

description: I'm impressed by their old fashion and their whiskey sour (two of my favorite cocktails).  They pretty much nailed it and I couldn't ask for any more.  Money well spent and no hangovers the next day.
author: Ronald L.

description: Good drinks, nice long bar so plenty of stools, and nice bartenders. They have a large whiskey selection as well as anything else you might crave. Haven't tried the food but it looks decent as well. Good spot if you are in the hood for happy hour...
author: Nicolas H.

description: This place is legit. I came here post Saturday brunch and it was the exactly wha my group and I needed. Great drinks. Great bourbon. Amazing oyster selection. Highly recommend this place. Wonderful staff as well!!!
author: Mallory Z.

description: Great spot, very loud before Giants game but great food and good beers.
author: Chaz C.

description: First time at this lovely/quaint bar. Definitely coming back again. The drink menu is superb and the bar tender--Adam--is just as impressive. He is very attentive and knows how to  work the crowd effectively and humorously. The food was great (dunk confit bahn mi!!!)amongst many other carnivorous choices. Well done Lord George!
author: Ewa U.

description: Had a great time at Lord George on night #2.  Fun vibe, relaxed, tasty cocktails and really great food. Don't miss the roasted strawberry tartine! Great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Sue A.

description: What an incredible place---if I was a local this would be my hangout.  Beautiful bar and killer lighting at night with incredible mixologists. Especially Adam. Good God he knows his craft. Made the most amazing drinks and gave us hella good recommendations in the City. Lord George has my heart!
author: ThatGirl T.

description:
My spouse and I recently met a friend here for drinks. We each had two drinks. Specifically, I had Dreams Old Men Dream and Federal Sword. Dreams was a combination of three cocktails: Negroni, Manhattan, and Old Fashioned. And despite the enthusiasm displayed by our waitress for the drink, I felt that it was disappointing. The unique characteristics of each of the 'constituent drinks' were sacrificed in the creation of this cocktail. And while I like innovation--and absurdity even--I also like thoughtful balance. Harmony is the key to a good cocktail, and this one lacked it. Federal Sword, meanwhile, was much better balanced and had a delightful nose, though that is to be expected from rye and calvados.

To eat, we had the chopped salad, which didn't captivate my taste buds. In fact, I felt it was a bit soupy (likely owing to the small amount of lettuce in favor of cucumber and the choice of dressing). However, the other two members of my party were delighted by it, so I'd give the salad 4 stars with the understanding that its execution was fine and that it simply didn't agree with my palate.
author: Alastair C.

description: Lord George is the perfect spot for a cocktail and quick bite before or after dinner. We stopped by for an afternoon pick me up and that is exactly what we got. The cocktails are perfectly curated without being pretentious; nor do they take forever to make. My personal favorite was the Clean Getaway (yum). If you're an oyster person, this will be your heaven and if not, there are plenty tartines and snacks to keep you full and happy. Loved the atmosphere and the service was great. Honestly, I rarely have no complaints, but I really can't think of one.
author: Christina D.

description: This review is long overdue. Lord George has quickly become our neighborhood favorite. Delicious cocktails with a unique flair, tasty bites, a funky vibe, and unparalleled service. We've made great friends with nearly all of the bartenders, who each go above and beyond to create a warm and welcoming environment for locals and visitors alike. Highly recommended!
author: Lauren B.

description: Awesome to get drinks! Alyssa, our server, was great! Definitely one of the best places in soma for drinks with friends. Delicious oysters :)
author: Carissa B.

description: Great service! Friendly from the moment you walk in. Oysters are amazing and the drinks are great! Will come back again and again!
author: Jose C.

description: Wow!   It takes a lot for this crusty character to give 5 stars, but I'd give this place 6 stars if I could.   Everybody sez they have the best martini, but this place does (stirred not shaken).   Oysters were fresh and excellent fries and salad.   Finished off with a recommendation from Gina (who must be one of SF's best bartenders) for a post meal cocktail (perfect gin fizz).   Outstanding!   Reasonable price.  Great vibe.
author: Michael B.

description: This place offers food, but theres not too much on the menu! Cocktails were pretty good. The space was nice. Have more (and better) food and this will be unstoppable!
author: Dave N.

description: Wow what a fantastic addition to the neighborhood! Delicious drinks and food. Exceptional and friendly staff. Looking forward to enjoying my evenings after work here.
author: Matt N.

description: I wandered into this bar by accident.  What a treat.  Order "Dreams Old Men Dream" and don't look back.  It's a Manhattan, Negroni and Old Fashioned...combined.  One of the best cocktails I've ever had.  Fun bartenders and better vibe.  Stumble in or plan it out, you won't go wrong.
author: Gustavo R.

description: My office had our holiday party here in 2015. The whole process was seamless from planning to execution, and the event was a huge success! The staff is fun and friendly, the food was delicious, and the drinks were on point. Now whenever a visitor to the office or a friend in the area asks for a recommendation for a bar/restaurant in SOMA, this is where I send them. They'll take good care of you.
author: Jessica M.

description: Woah - this place kicks ass. My first impression was great ambiance then when I began interacting with the staff, I was so surprised at how friendly and sociable they were. Boots is quite literally the best bartender EVER. He recommended me the Cobra Kai - which I proudly had 6 of throughout the night - and is now one of my favorite drinks. The food was also spectacular - Fresh tuna bites on a crisp cracker was FANTASTIC!! So happy I found this place. Highly recommend it! :)
author: Allen S.

description: Came to San Francisco for the superbowl. Great drinks and environment to watch the game. Amazing Drinks and attentive service!
author: Troy B.

description: Just found this spot!  Great bar, great cocktail menu and great staff.  They will do very well in this location if they are able to keep the quality of service up!
author: Clark A.

description:
Great drinks, nice atmosphere, AMAZING staff! I came here for a cocktail on a Wednesday afternoon before a company scavenger hunt. Got a gin drink, Jungle Fever or something, tasted like sunshine and Summer in a glass. 

Later in the day when we were on our scavenger hunt we needed help taking a paparazzi style picture. The staff was happy to help, made me a fake martini, and let us take over a booth for our photo shoot. They were great sports. I will def be back for happy hour 1/2 oysters!!
author: Aimee A.

description: Fantastic bar, Shane be bartender is great. Oysters were fresh and awesome, good cocktails (with quality mixers) and one of the best charcuterie boards ever. Epic.
author: Paul S.

description: Nice sports bar. I love the name and just love the attitude. It's a bit uppity but anyplace where you can get Oysters and cocktails is ok with me.
author: Rachel T.

description: This place was awesome the staff is really nice and the people that I met there were also great. The atmosphere is chill and inviting considering they just opened I think the already have a pretty good vibe established I highly recommend it
author: Allan I.

description: This review will be short. I am SERIOUS about my manhattans. I make them at home often, and I order them at virtually every place I go. So, I've tried many. Until I'm proven wrong, the best manhattan to be had in SF is at Lord George. Try it, prove wrong!
author: Drew W.

description: Creative cocktails, good selection of wine and beer. I would pass on the food as the menu is limited.. I wasn't that impressed with the selection and a few things we wanted to order were no longer available and food was only okay.  It's definitely a happening place but really loud so be prepared for a lot of yelling to carry a conversation. Service was good even though it was a busy night. I think I'll head to 21st amendment next door the next time I'm in the area.
author: Christine H.

description: Solid place for drinks and food near AT&T park. I ordered the Dreams Old Men Dream (combo of Old Fashioned, Negroni, and Manhatten) and really enjoyed it. It's definitely on the sweeter side and but still enjoyable. We also ordered the oysters, charcuterie platter, clam chowder and duck confit open sandwich. I thought the food was solid but very typical of what you can find in many other similar venues in SF. I found the volume a bit loud loud to the point where it required us to yell so the waiter could get our order. Also made it hard for a conversation between two people. I recommend coming here with a larger group or make sure to sit at the bar of its just for a party of two. Kind of felt like an a-hole for taking up a whole table with just two people.
author: Victor H.

description: Love that they had Modern Time (think hoppy wheat beer) in their bottle/can program. The staff takes their beverage and food menu seriously but they do not take themselves seriously, which is what I want in a bar. We will be back again!
author: Shane C.

description: This is for the bartenders working on 8/27/16. Didn't pay attention to anyone at the bar. Took us 20 minutes to get a drink. One bartender left his station to chat up friends at a table. I usually love getting food before giants Games. Not sure we will come back. Get new bartenders!
author: Nikki A.

description: Lord George is great! Drinks were perfect. Oysters were fresh. The staff was fun to talk to. We were there on a Saturday afternoon - was empty when we got there and was starting to fill up by the time we left. The French fries hit the spot too. I'd come back anytime.
author: Eric A.

description: Pretty cool bar. Not much of a food menu. Drinks were good, bartenders were good as well. Food menu can approve. If your looking for drinks on the low, Lord George knows.
author: D P.

description: My friend took me here when I visited and I was blown away.  Their happy hour menu is such an amazing deal and I ended up ordering too many oysters.  The bartender was amazing (the whole service was amazing,  actually) and everything came out promptly despite the number of people there. I can't wait to come back!
author: Taylor K.

description: First time for our party of six and, lucky for us, we got the VIP treatment!  Our original plans included a few drinks and a few bites and then off to a restaurant for a "real" meal but we liked the place so much that we ended up staying and enjoying a feast of nearly every item on the menu!  Actually, I think it was the fancy cocktails that kept us there.  I don't even know what I was drinking (I just asked Adam our gifted bartender to "surprise me!") and he succeeded by serving one deliciously potent potion after another.  All the staff treated us like lords and ladies, but it was special thanks to Adam that we all staggered off happily ever after (with Uber drivers taking us safely home)!
author: Shirley B.

description: I come here about twice a week. They have good selection of whisky and friendly staff. The atmosphere is what this place is all about. You will come upset and leave happy!
author: Khalad H.

description: Just returned from SANTA FE and this place is out of sight compared to some of the restaurants that I visit Lord George by far superior service great menu selection and above all friendly friendly clean establishment I will rate thisfive star
author: David J.

description:
Grand Opening-9/3/15
7pm-?
Arrived at 8:15, jammed, loud with a great crowd.
The entrance is now glass so you can see the oyster bar and energy.
Atmosphere: light, contemporary, but "Olde English" Lord George
Barset: same as Nova-long bar left, 4-top tables right with intimate lounge seating for 8 at end.
Staff: Adam, Dustin and Daniel (didn't get all names), very attentive, exceptional knowledge of Simple and Fancy cocktails, fun but not contrived.
My boyfriend and I will return to experience the above AND the menu.

South Park by day.....Lord George by night
Ann
author: Ann F.

description: Oh my gosh! This place is so awesome, we will for sure be back. We went to SF for our anniversary and decided to go here for "brunch". I was craving oysters and this seemed like the best place with that and a bar. According to yelp, there were two other places that might have had really delicious menus but they weren't hungry and/or were on the wharf. And I totally did not feel like dealing with the parking, crowds, etc. So Lord George it was. We were the first ones there (pretty much got there at 11am when they opened).  I'm so glad we went there because the oysters were delicious!! We also started off with bloody marys which went perfect. We were going to go off and bar hop after that but the bartender was so awesome we decided to stay. We also had to find wi-fi around 1pm so my boyfriend could do some work stuff and they had it there. We stayed until probably two oclock because the bartender made us feel so comfortable and  was making us awesome drinks! I can't wait to go back to SF and make this one of our regular places.
author: Veronica R.

description: Service was very bad, we had 3 checks and each contained items we didn't order!!! It's good we paid attention
author: Elena P.

description: A great addition to SOMA. Fresh oysters, solid beer list,  and creative dishes. Excited to welcome Lord George to the neighborhood!
author: Danyal K.

description: great bar. great service.  Jessica was so attentive and helpful.  My buddy asked for a rare drink (like a Sazerac) and the bartender not only knew it but it was fantastic.
author: Nolan R.

description: Great neighborhood gastropub! The cocktails are fantastic and you won't get any attitude from the friendly bartenders.
author: Rebecca P.

description: The place is perfect for before a ball game or just hanging out after work. Love the raw bar... they had a great selection of oysters and all the seafood is super fresh and clean. Great drink list too. Lord George is a perfect compliment to the neighborhood.
author: Jeff D.

description: Liked Nova but love the Lord George. Perfect place to grab a cocktail before a Giants game or grab some oysters for happy hour after work. Fancy food but not intimidating. Enjoyed the Ham and Cheese Tartine, fries along with the meat and cheese platter. Stylish bar and timeless glass wear that matches what Lords and Ladies should be drinking out of. SOMA needed a place like this.
author: Kevin M.

description: Cocktails are well made. Food is not your typical bar bites. We had the clam chowder and the butternut squash soup, both excellent, as were the ham and cheese tartine, and the beet and quinoa salad. The jumbo prawns were chilled & fresh. We sat at the bar, enjoyed great service and light conversation with the staff. Will definitely be back!
author: Vicky W.

description: Very nice decor and atmosphere. Food was very good, cocktails excellent, service outstanding. Price fairly reasonable for what you get.
author: Cole G.

description: Had a fantastic time at Lord George this past Friday! The cocktails, food and vibe about this place is great. Jason the bartender is awesome, very professional and made our night one to remember! I'd recommend this place to anyone.... 5 stars!!!
author: Ann M.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood!  I had the salad and everything tasted very fresh and flavorful.  Can't wait to go back and try more things from the menu!
author: nara n.

description: Amazing cocktail selection and delicious food. We had a big group so we sampled most of the menu. Favorites were the strawberry tartine, daiquiri, fries, and charcuterie, but everything was great!
author: S O.

description: food is really good and service as well. they have very nice sea food and very nice service. my only concern was drinks. drinks  were not so good. you guys need to work on it for sure. but still coming back for food and nice atmosphere.
author: Dahlia W.

description: My new favorite bar in sf. Staff is awesome, drinks are awesome, snacks are awesome. I'm a big gin guy and it's so rare when you find a bar that can actually make a good gin martini. Also had the clean getaway cocktail and damn was that thing smooth. Super fresh oysters, crispy salty fries, And legit charcuterie board. These are pretty much all the things I need. I see some people hating on them because they don't serve a full menu. It's a bar people. Enjoy the delicious bar bites they serve, or go back to the Cheesecake Factory for your popcorn shrimp and 7 alarm chili. This place is the real deal and I'm spreading the word.
author: jeff w.

description: We came here after a baseball game the other night. First off the staff was extremely friendly and had no problem waiting on all of us while we decided on what we wanted. Second their drink selection is great and third, we will be going back soon just from how friendly the bartenders were. They made us feel at home even though we had never been there before. We got fries, empanadas and several beers. The empanadas were great and extremely flavorful. Fries were good also! But they best part was that I had an event going on and I had to leave my girlfriend here while I was at it, the bartender almost watched over her and kept checking on her the entire time she was there alone since I couldn't be there with her. He kept asking if anyone was bothering her and made her feel very welcomed which doesn't happen too often especially in a big city. We are extremely grateful that the staff was so friendly and we would all recommend this place to anyone wanting to have a good night out.
author: Josh W.

description: Came here after a late night long run with a friend at 10pm. We were starving and we were bummed at first when the waiter/bartender said there were only oysters, fries, and charcuterie to eat. We ordered all of the above to share and it was all delicious and filled us up! 1/2 dozen of a variety of oysters, 3 item board (calabrese, buzzed cheese, and broccolini), and fries. The cheese had an espresso/lavender rind and was amazing. Presentation for everything was very good. The waiter was very nice and explained our food each time and was super patient. When we ordered the Cobra Kai cocktail to taste/share he even put it in 2 glasses for us. That was also very well made and delicious with a lemon twist in it. The oysters were incredibly fresh (one of the freshest I've tasted in the city thus far). The price is higher than many other gastropubs/bars nearby but truly well worth it! I would definitely come back for the food and good service!
author: m s.
